item.description: 220809 Saga Pattern has been replicated _2017 It took longer than I wanted to and stole my will a few times, but we’re here now. Okay so there is still some work to be done on it.

220801 Saga Runner I am working on getting the saga its list of commands to execute. I made some notes to help me with error handling /* Order of Transaction is import in passed ListOfTransactions - Compensatable Transactions: -- NOTE: Compensatable Transactions should have two Transaction Commands.

220726 Okay I’ve been working the saga pattern. It took me a while of paper and thinking to figure it out. I have the concept worked out. Looking at it now it seems simple, but it took me a lot of big thinking to figure it out.

_2321 I had some code written for a saga, Its not perfect, but I would like to start to mess with it. package saga import ( "fmt" "io" "net/http" "strings") type Saga struct { SageName string Transactions []*transaction } type transaction struct { TransactionName string ServiceName string TransactionAction } func (t *transaction) GetTransaction() *transaction { return t } //TODO find a better name for this.

220105 Running off generator power, ten inches of snow. TBA the return of normal power, water, and data services. Microservices Patterns Book : Having been given an unplanned opportunity to read, I’ve been getting through this microservices patterns book.
220101 Now What So I am going to try and break down each of the services that I have created to SQL schemes/Queries with the necessary item so that don’t have go into the database for any reason.
